result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamarious M Shoulders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jamarious M Shoulders is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jamarious M Shoulders was found guilty of 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Jamarious M Shoulders was found guilty of Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $518  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with PST.

Comply with sex offender evaluation and treatment as recommended. Comply with sex offender registry.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Sentencing hearing on October 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of no contest on counts 2 & 3.  Count 1 dismissed upon motion of the State. Reporter:  Karen Howell
Defendant waived reading of Information.  Defendant by Counsel entered a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued; set for plea hearing
Arraignment on May 21, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
and returned

Reporter: Heather Kieta
re: defn's motion to modify bail.  Argument by Atty. Khandhar; Argument by Atty. Kaiser; Rebuttal argument by Atty. Khandhar.  Court denied motion.  Bail amened to BMP referral; all other conds remain the same.  Bail continued.

AMENDED CASH BOND - DEFENDANT REFERRED TO BMP
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000. per case.  If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with P.S.T. 
- Defendant shall not be on the 5800th block of Russett Rd in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with female juveniles.
